title: 105_hr2170
content: CHAPTER 90--MISCELLANEOUS EMPLOYEE BENEFITS: This section adds a new provision for reimbursement of adoption expenses under Subpart G of part III of title 5, United States Code. Sec. 9001 of Chapter 90 allows for reimbursement of adoption expenses, including fees charged by adoption agencies, legal fees, counseling fees, and medical expenses. Reimbursement for adoption expenses may include legal fees, counseling fees, medical expenses, foster-care charges, and transportation expenses. Agency employees adopting a child can be reimbursed for these expenses under specific regulations. The reimbursement is provided after the adoption is finalized, the child is under 18 years old and unmarried, and a written application is submitted on time. Reimbursement for adoption expenses is available for employees if the child is under 18 years old, unmarried, and a written application is submitted on time. The reimbursement amount is capped at $2,000 and is only payable if other benefits do not cover the full expenses. If both adopting parents are eligible, each can receive reimbursement, with a maximum limit set. The guidelines for reimbursement under this section include restrictions on payment amounts to adoptive parents to prevent exceeding total adoption expenses or $5,000. The Office of Personnel Management can issue necessary guidelines for uniform administration. Application denial based on marital status is prohibited. The Office of Personnel Management can issue guidelines for uniform administration of regulations in Executive agencies. The Office may provide assistance upon request to carry out this section. Conforming amendments are made to the heading of subpart G of title 5, United States Code. The text discusses amendments to title 5, United States Code, regarding annuities, insurance, and miscellaneous benefits. It also addresses the applicability of these changes to Postal Service employees and specifies the effective date of the Act.
